body_html:
Yes, mkl 2017.0.3. The same version as in my torch 0.2 virtualenv which works fine.

edit: I created a new env from scratch, cleaned all the caches in conda and reinstalled numpy, mkl, pytorch. It still not seeing the mkl library.

edit: I couldn't find libmkl_gf_lp64.so in any of the mkl packages installed in my virtualenvs.
body_text:
Yes, mkl 2017.0.3. The same version as in my torch 0.2 virtualenv which works fine.
edit: I created a new env from scratch, cleaned all the caches in conda and reinstalled numpy, mkl, pytorch. It still not seeing the mkl library.
edit: I couldn't find libmkl_gf_lp64.so in any of the mkl packages installed in my virtualenvs.
body:
Yes, `mkl 2017.0.3`. The same version as in my `torch 0.2` virtualenv which works fine.

edit: I created a new env from scratch, cleaned all the caches in conda and reinstalled `numpy`, `mkl`, `pytorch`. It still not seeing the `mkl` library.

edit: I couldn't find `libmkl_gf_lp64.so` in any of the `mkl` packages installed in my virtualenvs.
